Class WereWolfenstein2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • kit101.QuickGUI
              • WereWolfenstein2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class WereWolfenstein2D
extends kit101.QuickGUI
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    KIT101 Assignment 2 WereWolfenstein 2D -- Organiser Class A class of WereWolfenstein2D game contains all the methods to play the game.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  WereWolfenstein2D.State
      An enum that indicate different states of the game PLAY Ask for play DIFF ask for difficulty ACTION ask for action POS ask for position (only for walk, shoot action)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WereWolfenstein2D()
      A constructor to show the game name, explain how to play and create new scanner to read input from player, as well as create a new GameWorld prepare for each game.

      Contains all steps for the shoot action: Ask for the area to shoot Shoot to that area reduce the number of bullets Print the answer if the shoot success or not Check if out of bullets after the shoot

      • drawMap

        private void drawMap(java.awt.Graphics g,
                     java.awt.Color c)
        Draw a map with 3*3 small square, show village position if found, current play position. Automatically save and update the position of the village if player walk / shoot into (show as green box) Current position show as blue box
        Parameters:
        g - current graphics component
        c - default color for each small square (position)

      • drawHPBar

        private void drawHPBar(java.awt.Graphics g,
                       java.lang.String label,
                       int hpLeft,
                       int hpTop,
                       int hpW,
                       int hpH,
                       int hpBorder,
                       int curr,
                       int total)
        Draw a HP bar, change color when low HP, with black border, white background
        Parameters:
        g - current graphics
        label - Name of the bar
        hpLeft - Left position
        hpTop - Top position
        hpW - Width
        hpH - Height
        hpBorder - thickness of the border
        curr - current point
        total - total point
